definition: to bemoan the state of the universe and pity the fate of mankind
to sympathize/to pity/to feel compassion for

sentences.english: Beth kept on, with only slight relapses into idleness or grieving.
sentences.chinese: 只有贝思坚持不懈，极少躲懒或悲天悯人。

sentences.english: Her spirit and compassion live on today.
sentences.chinese: 她的精神和悲天悯人至今仍留存于世。

sentences.english: Han Shan was a kind-hearted monk and also a poet.
sentences.chinese: 寒山是唐朝僧人，也是一个悲天悯人的诗人。

sentences.english: Now this sort of sentimentality always makes me furious.
sentences.chinese: 直到今天，这号悲天悯人地情调每每令我发指。

sentences.english: The third chapter is about the women's compassion of"Mother Earth".
sentences.chinese: 第三章写女性悲天悯人的“地母”情怀。

definition: devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
(Buddhism) to deliver all living creatures from suffering (idiom)
to view death as a return home/to not be afraid of dying/to face death with equanimity (idiom)
to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
to abandon self for others (idiom, from Analects); to sacrifice one's own interest for other people/altruism
